user-agreement.title: User Agreement and Privacy Policy
user-agreement.agreement-title: I understand and accept the user agreement and privacy policy form
user-agreement.text:
Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. This information is necessary for reaching the gateway to your personal health records. When PHR System users provide their personal information, this information shall not be disclosed unless the circumstances specified by the relevant legislation occur or the consent of the data subjects is obtained, and shall be protected in compliance with the highest security and privacy standards.

The data controller is obliged to take all necessary technical and organizational measures to provide an appropriate level of security for the purposes of:

  • preventing unlawful processing of personal data,
  • preventing unlawful access to personal data,
  • ensuring protection of personal data.
user-agreement.info-text:
Through the PHR Application (“Application”), the Ministry of Public Health in Qatar aims to provide improved public health services to enable individuals in Qatar to view, control, and manage their health-related data using innovative and modern information systems, technologies, and digital solutions.
The Ministry of Public Health is based in Qatar. Our principal activity is providing healthcare services.
Our privacy policies cover the use of the Application. The Application is bound by the e-Government Policies of the State of Qatar (per Council of Ministers' Resolution No. (18) of 2010 on the Implementation of e-Government Policies) and Qatar’s Data Protection Law (Law No. 13 of 2016) concerning the privacy and protection of personal data.
By using this Application, you acknowledge that you have read and accepted our “Terms and Conditions” and “Privacy Policy”, which are available in both Arabic and English. In the event of any difference in interpretation between the Arabic and English text and any translation thereof, the Arabic text prevails.
The Application is owned and operated by the Ministry of Public Health of the State of Qatar (“MOPH”) and the relevant Government entities.
user-agreement.terms-text:
These Terms and Conditions (“Terms”), detailed hereinafter, govern your use of the PHR Application (“Application”). By accessing and using the Application, you are deemed to have understood and agreed to the terms.
The Application is owned and operated by the Ministry of Public Health of the State of Qatar (“MOPH”) and the relevant Government entities.
MOPH reserves the right to vary, amend or modify or impose new conditions in these Terms and Conditions at any time without any notification to you. Any such variations, amendments or modifications will be reflected by an update on the Application. You are therefore responsible for checking these Terms and Conditions periodically to be aware of any such changes. Your continued access of this service following the posting of any changes to these Terms and Conditions shall constitute your acceptance and agreement of the same.
user-agreement.copyright-text:
All materials on this Application, are protected by copyrights, trademarks, and/or other intellectual property rights. These materials are owned by MOPH or are used with permission from their owners or as otherwise authorized by law. Protected materials include, but are not limited to, the text, trademarks, source code, databases, logos, photographs, images, video clips, audio clips, designs, trade dress, and other materials contained in this Application. All rights are reserved, worldwide.
All other use of any material (including, without limitation, photographs, articles, press releases, software, comments, tables or charts, video clips, logos) on this Application is strictly prohibited. By way of illustration, such prohibited use may include the extraction, redistribution, republication, modification, broadcasting, sale, or otherwise making available of any of the information or material on this Application (in any format) to third parties. In addition to this restriction, you agree to comply with all copyright notices, information, or restrictions contained in any material accessed through this Application. Unauthorized use of this Application, or any of the information or material contained on this Application, is illegal and as such may give rise to, amongst other things, a claim for damages and may also be a criminal offence.
user-agreement.unauthorized-text:
You agree that you will use this application only for the purpose for which it is intended. You will not attempt to interfere with the operation of this Application or alter or corrupt any related data or software. You understand that if you attempt to alter or corrupt any related data or software, it may lead to denial of access to this Application and possibly legal action being brought against you.

Failure to Comply:
You agree to follow and abide by these Terms and Conditions and by all directives and instructions issued through the Application by the competent Authorities. You understand that a failure to follow all directives and instructions may lead to legal action being brought against you.
user-agreement.disclaimer-text:
1. Whilst the Product Information and all other application material is provided in good faith, by using this Application, you agree and acknowledge that MOPH makes no representations, warranties, or claims as to the accuracy of the Product Information or any other material on these applications.
2. MOPH disclaims all implied warranties relating to your use of this Application and the information, products, and services contained in this application. To the maximum extent permissible under law, all information on this Application is provided without any warranty (either express or implied by law or otherwise) or implied term of any kind, including but not limited to any implied warranties or implied terms of satisfactory quality, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement of third party rights.
3. By using this Application, you agree that MOPH will not be liable to you for any direct, indirect, consequential, or any other loss arising from the use (or non-use) of the information, products, and services provided to you through this Application or from your access of other material via links from this application. The exclusions and limitations contained in these Terms and Conditions apply to the maximum extent permitted by law.
4. MOPH will be under no liability to you whatsoever, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, restitution, or otherwise for any injury, death, damage, or direct, indirect or consequential loss howsoever caused arising out of or in connection with the use of this Application or the use, accessing, downloading, or relying on any information or other materials contained in this applications, including, without limitation, as a result of any computer virus.
5. You shall indemnify MOPH and its licensors and keep MOPH and its licensors indemnified against all losses, damages, claims, and costs (including legal cost) caused or suffered by MOPH and/or its licensors as a result of a breach by you of any of these Terms and Conditions.
6. You understand and agree that you shall be accountable and be fully responsible at all times for: -maintaining the confidentiality of your access credentials to use this Application. You agree not to share and disclose your access credentials to any person whosoever and to take all reasonable precautions necessary to ensure that no other persons have access to the same. -If you discover any breach of security or have reasonable grounds to believe that someone has used your Passcode without your authorization, or has, in your judgment, violated these Terms and Conditions, you should change your passcode immediately. - In case that you lose the device on which you have downloaded the Application, you should immediately reactivate this Application and create a new account.
7. It is the user's responsibility to independently verify the accuracy, currency, completeness, relevance and fitness of all information input by the user or output by this Application prior to executing any transaction using this Application.
8. MOPH will not be liable for any degradation in the quality of this Application or the unavailability of this this Application.
9. MOPH will not be liable in case there is an unforeseen downtime due to network outages, problem at the hosting facility or any other reason beyond our control which may result in non-availability of this application for any duration.
10. MOPH may suspend and/or terminate your access to this application immediately for any reason without notice and without any liability whatsoever should you be in breach of these terms and conditions or for any other cause.
user-agreement.modification-text: Terms and Conditions and/or other information provided on this Application may be updated, amended, changed, or removed by MOPH at any time and without further notice to you. The Terms ans Conditions will always be updated and available through the Application. You should review these Terms and Conditions every time you visit the Application. By using this Application, you agree to be bound by the latest version of such Terms and Conditions.
user-agreement.miscellaneous-text:
1. These Terms and Conditions (including the Privacy Policy) contain all the terms relating to the use of this Application. These Terms and Conditions supersede all previous contracts, arrangements, representations, terms implied by law, and understandings between the parties whether written, arising from custom, orally, or otherwise. These Terms and Conditions are written in Arabic and English. If you do not understand Arabic or English, please seek assistance in order to understand these Terms and Conditions, as you will be deemed to have understood and accepted these Terms and Conditions upon use of the Application. In the event of a difference between the two texts, the text in the Arabic language shall prevail.
2. If any part of these Terms and Conditions is found by any court, tribunal, administrative body, or authority of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid, or unenforceable, then that provision will, to the extent required, be severed from these Terms and Conditions and will be ineffective without, as far as possible, modifying any other parts of these Terms and Conditions and this will not affect any other provisions of the amended Terms and Conditions, which will remain in full force and effect.
3. There shall be no waiver of any term, provision, or condition of these Terms and Conditions, unless such waiver is evidenced in writing and signed by the party granting such waiver.
4. The Terms and Conditions of this Application and the materials contained within the Application shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Qatar. The Qatari courts shall have non-exclusive jurisdiction to adjudicate any disputes, which may arise as a result. You agree that MOPH reserves the right to bring an action against you in any country it deems appropriate.
If you have any questions about the application, or our Terms of Use, please contact: MOPH 109
user-agreement.privacy-text:
Overview
Your privacy is very important to MOPH, and we understand how important it is to you. We want you to feel safe when using this application and are committed to maintaining your privacy when you use the Application. We require our employees, suppliers, and partners to maintain confidentiality in accordance with applicable data protection laws.
This Privacy Policy (together with our Terms and Conditions) sets out the basis on which we process any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us. Please read the following carefully to understand our views and practices regarding your personal data.
This Privacy Policy can be changed over time to comply with the law or to meet our changing business requirements.
By "Personal Data," we mean any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. By using this Application, you acknowledge your full agreement to MOPH's use of all your personal data for the purpose of the work of this application, and that you grant MOPH full and unconditional permission to use this information.
This policy is an integral part of the previous Terms and Conditions, and all Terms and Conditions are applicable.
user-agreement.data-text:
Your personal data, all electronic storage and transmission of personal data shall be safeguarded and secured with appropriate security technologies. By choosing to use the Application, you agree to:
● Share your personal data with MOPH, and the relevant personal data will only be shared with other Government agencies in Qatar, to serve you, and the broader public’s health and safety, in a most efficient and effective manner, unless such sharing is prohibited by law.
● Display personal data you had previously shared with MOPH or other Government agencies in Qatar. We will retain your personal data only as necessary for the effective delivery of public services.
This Application may contain links to enable you to visit third-party websites, mobile sites and mobile applications which are governed by their own privacy policies. Please note that we do not have any control over these and are not responsible or liable for the protection and privacy of any information that you provide whilst visiting those sites.
In the event that you are to disclose Personal Data on behalf of another person, you will ensure that the individual whose Personal Data is supplied to MOPH has authorized the disclosure, is informed of and consents to processing of their Personal Data in accordance with this Privacy Notice. Where the disclosure is in respect of a child’s Personal Data, you should do so only as the parent or legal guardian of that child and enter into relevant contracts on behalf of that child.
user-agreement.disclosure-text:
We do not disclose your personal data to any non-Government agency in the State of Qatar, except:
● Where such entities have been authorized to carry out specific Government services in Qatar. By using this Application, you acknowledge your acceptance of the Privacy Policy.
● To third parties, including law enforcement officials, law courts and government and regulatory authorities: (a) if we believe disclosure is required by any applicable law, regulation or legal process (such as to respond to subpoenas or judicial orders); or (b) to protect and defend our rights, or the rights or safety of third parties, including to defend against legal claims.
● When third parties act as data processors of your Personal Data, based on MOPH instructions. We enter into an agreement with the relevant data processor for the processing of your Personal Data. In this agreement, we include obligations to ensure that your Personal Data is processed by the data processor solely to provide services to us and to ensure that the data processor has adequate safeguards in place and complies with the applicable data protection laws.
user-agreement.privacy-support-text:
If you have any inquiry or concern about our privacy policy, please contact us at mailto:info@phrapp.qa or Tel 109.
We will retain Personal Data for as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purpose for which it was collected as described in this Privacy Policy and in line with our data retention policies, or as required by relevant laws.
When erasing Personal Data, we will take reasonable and technically possible measures to make the Personal Data irrecoverable or irreproducible in accordance with the applicable laws.
You can request access, rectification, review of processing, of your Personal Data that MOPH processes at any time by sending a request via the Contact Us page of this Application. Any request must include the following information: your name and address and any other information which may identify you.
user-agreement.change-policy-text: MOPH reserves the right to change, adapt, adjust this Privacy Policy on the Application without any prior notification. You acknowledge and agree that this Policy may change from time to time. By using this application, you agree to be bound by the latest version of such policy.

personal-information.title: Personal Information
personal-information.text:
Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. This information is necessary for reaching the gateway to your personal health records. When PHR System users provide their personal information, this information shall not be disclosed unless the circumstances specified by the relevant legislation occur or the consent of the data subjects is obtained, and shall be protected in compliance with the highest security and privacy standards.

The data controller is obliged to take all necessary technical and organizational measures to provide an appropriate level of security for the purposes of:

  • preventing unlawful processing of personal data,
  • preventing unlawful access to personal data,
  • ensuring protection of personal data.

contact-information.title: Contact Information
contact-information.success: Your contact information has been saved successfully
contact-information.error: Your primary contact phone number has not been updated
contact-information.success-code: The verification code you have entered is correct.
contact-information.email-valid: Please enter a valid email address
contact-information.alert-info: Please click the add button to add contact information.
contact-information.hcp-number: Phone Number (latest recorded at last healthcare provider)
contact-information.phr-phone-number: Phone Number (registered by the user during the registration)
contact-information.not-editable-text: The displayed address is your residential address registered in Qatar. You cannot change this information through this application. To update your address information, please use Metrash2 application.
contact-information.edit-text: Select the phone number which will be used as the primary contact phone number for any Personal Health Record related functions.
contact-information.text:
Your contact information is necessary for facilitating effective healthcare. Your contact information shall not be disclosed unless the circumstances specified by the relevant legislation occur or the consent of the data subjects is obtained, and shall be protected in compliance with the highest security and privacy standards.

Emergency Contact information is necessary for managing emergency situations. The person/persons you have added in the emergency contact field will be contacted in case of an emergency and the relevant hospital and hospital location information will be shared.
contact-information.email-change-alert: Your request to update your e-mail address has been received. You will be logged out and asked to verify your new e-mail address upon your next login. Click on 'Save' if you want to continue.

consent-information.title: Consent Information
consent-information.success: Your consent information has been saved successfully
consent-information.consent-content1: Keeping this option selected will help your healthcare professionals make better decisions and improve your quality of care. If you deactivate this option, it will be more difficult for your healthcare professionals to have a full view of your medical records and provide you with the best care.
consent-information.consent-content2: Keeping this option selected will help the one healthcare professional who is treating you make better decisions and improve your quality of care, while maintaining the privacy of your information from other professionals. If you deactivate this option, it will be more difficult for your healthcare professionals to have a full view of your medical records and provide you with the best care.
consent-information.consent-content3: Keeping this option selected will help your pharmacist make informed decisions about your medications, and support better quality of care. If you deactivate this option, the pharmacist will only be able to view your medications that have been dispensed from that specific pharmacy.
consent-information.consent-content4: If you choose this option, only the practitioners you visit will be able to view your health data.
consent-information.consent-content5: If you choose this option, practitioners will be able to access your health data without your consent in emergencies. Practitioners will need your consent if you do not choose this option.
consent-information.consent-content6: If you choose this option, your health data will be used for research purpose without disclosing your identity.
consent-information.consent-content7: * Health professionals can access your health data via Break-the-glass access in case of a life-threatening situation (emergency situation). In such cases, the system will notify you. You can also view these accesses on the 'Records of access to my health data' page.
consent-information.swicth1: Grant all healthcare practitioners within the specific healthcare organizations that I am being treated at access to my non-sensitive health information for 2 days before, and 30 days after the day of my appointment within that specific facility. (This may include public healthcare organizations and larger private healthcare organizations) For smaller private healthcare facilities, only the specific practitioner with whom you have an appointment will have access to your non-sensitive health information for 2 days before, and 30 days after the day of your appointment.
consent-information.swicth2: Grant only the healthcare professional with whom I have an appointment the access to my sensitive health information for 24 hours before, and another 24 hours after the time of my appointment.
consent-information.swicth3: Grant the pharmacist dispensing my medications the permission to view all medications that either have been prescribed and/or I am currently using.
consent-information.swicth4: Only Healthcare Professional who examined me.
consent-information.swicth5: Allow all access to my data in case of emergency
consent-information.swicth6: My health data can be used for research without sharing my identity information
consent-information.swicth4-title: HCP roles that can view my health data
consent-information.success-modal: Your user has been created. Please Login again.
consent-information.text:
Consent Information is necessary to control who views your longitudinal health records. Allowing healthcare professionals to view your health data facilitates easier condition of problems and conditions, and efficient decision making with respect to treatments and procedures.

Your personal information and health data shall be disclosed only to the persons you have given consent to and shall be protected in compliance with the highest security and privacy standards. You can opt in and out of the consent management options anytime.
consent-information.disclaimer-text: The options below specify how your health information will be shared with healthcare professionals. Please customize as per your preference.

email-confirm.title: Verify E-mail Address
email-confirm.warning-alert: Please enter the verification code sent to your '
email-confirm.warning-alert-2: ' e-mail address. After successful verification, your new e-mail address will be saved and updated.

account-settings.title: Deactivate My Profile
account-settings.deactivate-message: Are you sure you want to deactivate your account?
account-settings.deactivate-profile: Your account has been deactivated upon your request. To reactivate your account, you will need to re-register.
account-settings.suspended-profile: Your account has been suspended. Please contact MoPH to reactivate your account.

self-added-vitals.greater-than-diastolic: Systolic must be greater than diastolic
self-added-vitals.less-than-systolic: Diastolic must be less than systolic

vaccination.info-message: No vaccine has been found in the desired age range.
vaccination.info-yellow: Influenza vaccines are recommended annually, starting at age 6 during the flu season, especially for high-risk persons.
vaccination.info-red: Two doses of Hepatitis A Vaccine are recommended for children and adolescents with frequent travel to high-risk countries.
vaccination.info-purple: Meningococcal vaccines are recommended starting at the age of 2 for Hajj and Umra and travelers to endemic areas.
vaccination.info-orenge: Recommended vaccination for adults with an additional risk factor or another indication.
vaccination.info-green1: Recommended vaccination for adults who meet age requirement, lack documentation of vaccination, or lack evidence of past infection.
vaccination.info-blue: Recommended vaccination based on shared clinical decision-making.
vaccination.info-text-2: 2. HEXA: Hepatitis B, DTaP, Hib, IPV
vaccination.info-text-5: * DTaP alone or Pentaxim or any vaccine containing DTaP may be used at 18 months if Tetra is not available. DTaP/DTP/DT vaccine should not be used above 6 years of age. Use Tdap/Td instead.
vaccination.info-text-6: ** Tdap (Boostrix brand) can be used if DTap is not available.
vaccination.info-text-7: * MMR, VAR and HPV vaccinations should not be administered during pregnancy.
vaccination.info-text-8: * MMR and VAR vaccinations should not be administered for the following conditions:
vaccination.info-text-8-2: - HIV infection with CD4 < 15 % and count of <200 mm³
vaccination.info-text-9: * Precaution-vaccination might be indicated if benefit of protection outweighs risk of adverse reaction for MenB vaccine in pregnancy.
vaccination.vaccination-childhood-alert-info: This timeline shows the required childhood vaccination scheme in Qatar. You should check with your practitioner regarding your child's current vaccination scheme.
vaccination.bowel-cancer-desc: Screening can help detect colorectal cancer early. Pre-cancerous polyps—abnormal growths inside the colon or rectum—can be detected by screening and removed before turning into cancer. If cancer is present, screening can find it at an early stage when treatment is most effective.
vaccination.colonoscopy-desc: Screening can help detect colorectal cancer early. Pre-cancerous polyps—abnormal growths inside the colon or rectum—can be detected by screening and removed before turning into cancer. If cancer is present, screening can find it at an early stage when treatment is most effective.
vaccination.dexa-desc: DEXA (DXA) scans are used to measure bone density and assess the risk of bone fractures. They're often used to help diagnose bone-related conditions, such as osteoporosis, or assess the risk of developing them.
vaccination.cervical-cancer-desc: A Pap smear (also called a Pap test) is a screening procedure for cervical cancer. It tests for the presence of precancerous or cancerous cells on the cervix, the opening of the uterus.
vaccination.mamogram-desc: A screening mammogram is a simple, non-invasive exam that can help detect potential breast cancer at the earliest possible time.
vaccination.vision-exam-desc: Early signs of age-related eye diseases, including cataract, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy and age-related macular degeneration can begin in midlife but often do not noticeably affect the vision until later.
vaccination.glaucoma-desc: Glaucoma screening is a 'general screening' to detect those with early stage disease, so that those patients can be treated to reduce the risk of visual field loss.
vaccination.retinopathy-desc: Diabetic Retinopathy screening is a test to check for eye problems caused by diabetes. Screening is conducted annually.

observation.family-body: Family Health History panel contains records of the diseases and health conditions of the patient.
observation.social-body: Social History panel contains the patient's occupational, personal, social and environmental history and health risk factors that may impact the patient's health.
observation.vital-signs-body: Social Signs History panel contains clinical observations such as blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, height, weight, body mass index, head circumference, pulse oximetry, temperature, and body surface area.
observation.name: Name

allergy.name: Allergy
allergy.other-alert-text: This section shows self recorded allergies, please make sure your physician is aware of them.
allergy.show-active-allergies-check: Show all Allergies Including Active and Inactive

test-lab-result.name: Name
test-lab-result.alert-text-data: Graph view is not applicable for this lab result due to its non-numeric test values.

encounter-visit.title: Visits History
encounter-visit.appointment-info: No future appointments available within the next 1 year.

data.date-range-text: You are viewing your results between

data.not-found: You have no data for this category

medication.label-days-of-use: Days of use of the drug
medication.alert-box-text: You must have an active medication to be able to set a medication reminder.
medication.medication-add-alert: To add a medication reminder, please select a medication from the active medications list on the left pane, then specify the time of the first dose and click generate schedule.
medication.active-desc:
Active: Prescribed medications that you have received from the pharmacy within the appropriate time period.
Prescribed: Prescribed medications that you have not received from the pharmacy while the appropriate time period for dispensing has not passed yet.
medication.passive-desc: Inactive: Prescribed medications that you have <bold>not</bold> received from the pharmacy within the appropriate time period, or the end date of the usage period specified by the physician has passed.

prescription.prescription-info: This section displays the same information from medications list, however, grouped under their corresponding prescription number.

dashboard.non-risk-factor: None of the risk factors above found
dashboard.future-appointments-map: Select a future appointment to display the maps
dashboard.RCD-message: It is recommended to follow healthy life style recommendations. Please discuss the results of this calculation with your physician.
dashboard.RCD-model: Calculated based on SCORE2 risk charts.
dashboard.label-evaluate-placeholder: You can write your comment about the healthcare facility in this area
dashboard.dependants-menu: has shared the following health records with you. Please click on the related health record to open its dedicated page and view further details.
dashboard.covid-error-message: Service unavailable. Please try again later!

announcement-news.title: Announcement List
announcement-news.file-selected-text: Please click the add button to upload the file.
announcement-news.i-read: I have read it, don't show it again

audit-logs.confirm-message: Are you sure you want to report this user access to the Ministry of Public Health?
audit-logs.confirm-success: Thank you for reporting your access complaint to the Ministry of Public Health. Your data privacy is our upmost priority. Please be patient with us while we investigate your complaint. Someone will be in touch within due course.
audit-logs.label-show-all-log: Show All Logs Including Self Access
audit-logs.label-show-all-excluding-log: Show All Logs Excluding Self Access
audit-logs.label-break-the-glass: The access of healthcare professionals to your health records in case of emergency situations.
audit-logs.label-temporary-access: A temporary access that you granted to another Personal Health Record user through the Sharing page.
audit-logs.label-permanent-access: A permanent access that you granted to another Personal Health Record user through the Sharing page.
audit-logs.label-explicit-consent: Access of healthcare professionals to your health records under your consent after providing the code you received on your phone to them (OTP Authentication).
audit-logs.label-self-access: Any access after writing the correct username and password and logging in successfully to your PHR profile.
audit-logs.loading-message: Please wait while your request is being processed.

emergency-notes.title: Important Health Information
emergency-notes.list-disclaimer: The purpose of this section is to share additional important health information with your healthcare professional that is not highlighted elsewhere

my-documents.title: My Uploaded Documents
my-documents.total-file-size: You can upload PDF (max size 2 MB) and JPG (max size 2 MB) and PNG (max size 2 MB) files with a maximum total size of 50 MB.
my-documents.note-info: Only items selected for sharing will be shared with the healtcare providers.
my-documents.confirm-share: Shared documents will be available to health care professional who have access to your medical record. Are you sure you want to share?
my-documents.confirm-unShare: Are you sure you want to unshare?
my-documents.disclaimer-text: Only files you selected for sharing will be shared with the healthcare professionals
my-documents.option-photos: Photos (E.g., Pictures of Rashes, Wounds, Bruises, …)
my-documents.option-vaccination-documents: Vaccination Documents (E.g., Vaccination Certificate, Vaccines Received outside Qatar, …)
my-documents.option-x-ray: X-ray and Radiology Reports (E.g., X-ray, MRI, CT Scan, Ultrasound, …)
my-documents.option-laboratory: Laboratory Results (E.g., Blood Tests, Urine Tests, Stool Tests, …)
my-documents.option-test: Test Reports (E.g., ECG Studies, Biopsy Results, Lung Function Results, …)
my-documents.option-other-medical: Other Medical Documents and Reports (E.g., Medical History Record, Discharge Summary, …)

organ-donation.title: Organ Donation
organ-donation.alert-box-title: IN ORDER TO BE HOPE FOR ANOTHER LIFE I WANT TO DONATE MY ORGANS AFTER MY MEDICALLY PROVEN DEATH.
organ-donation.alert-box-text: I expect the Organ Donation unit to contact me for my donation.
organ-donation.alert-box-text-1: * This screen is for communication purposes only. The Organ Donor Department will contact you for organ donation operations...
organ-donation.organ-button: Forward the Organ Donation Notification to the Organ Donation Unit
organ-donation.save-error-message: Please select at least one organ for organ donation notification.
organ-donation.modal-text-1: Organ donation is the donation of biological tissue or an organ of the human body to someone who has a damaged organ that needs to be replaced. An organ transplant may save a person’s life or significantly improve their health and quality of life.
organ-donation.modal-text-2: You can be one of two types of donors:
organ-donation.modal-text-3: It is possible to donate organs while you are alive and save a life without risking your own. Living donors can donate a kidney, a portion of their liver, lung or intestine and in some instances, tissue. The best match for living donations is from a family member.
organ-donation.modal-text-4: Once a person has been declared brain dead, the patient’s family can exercise their choice to be an organ donor. Deceased donors can donate six types of organs; kidneys, pancreas, liver, lungs, heart and intestines. Deceased donors can also donate bones, skin, heart valves, veins and corneas.
organ-donation.modal-text-5: Whilst you are alive you can confirm your wish to be a deceased donor by signing up to the donor registry. A donor registry is a national confidential list of people who are willing to become organ donors after their death. People on the donor registry are issued with a ‘donor card’ that they carry with them. This indicates they have expressed a wish to be an organ donor, in the event of their death.
organ-donation.modal-title-3: An example of an Organ Donor Card
organ-donation.redirect-btn: Redirect me to Organ Donation Department's Website

bon-marrow-blood-donation.bon-marrow-delete-button: Delete Voluntary Bone Marrow Donor Request
bon-marrow-blood-donation.bon-marrow-volunteer: Your request to become a voluntary bone marrow donor have been forwarded to the relevant units.
bon-marrow-blood-donation.bon-marrow-volunteer-modal-title: Voluntary Bone Marrow Donor Approval Form
bon-marrow-blood-donation.bon-marrow-volunteer-modal-content:
Bone Marrow Donation, Frequently Asked Questions, Approval Form
What are Stem Cells?

Stem cells are cells that reside in bone marrow, a tissue that resembles the spleen, and can be transformed into new cells if the body needs it.

I want to volunteer for Bone Marrow Donation?

Bone marrow transplant is a transplant treatment that allows the healthy individual's stem cell to take care of the abnormal stem cell of the patient. This treatment ensures that patients have properly working stem cells.

In Which Diseases Is Bone Marrow Transplant Used?

Stem cell transplantation is used in the treatment of bone marrow cancers, lymphomas, various organ cancers, poorly functioning or inadequate bone marrow, hereditary anemia, immunodeficiency, hereditary metabolic diseases.

Who can donate bone marrow?

Every healthy individual between the ages of 18-50 years old who has been informed and has given consent can donate stem cells. Donors must identify themselves by giving their name-surname, date of birth (day / month / year), identity card number and permanent address information before stem cell donation. Proof of identity is a legal obligation.

Bone Marrow Donor Candidate Process Flow
  • Citizen becomes a voluntary bone marrow donor candidate with 'I want to become a bone marrow donor' via PHR.
  • The notification of the donor candidate drops to the pool of data in the Qatar Red Crescent.
  • The Qatar Red Crescent informs the voluntary candidate's information to the Volunteer Data Centers.
  • The Volunteer Data Centers will forward the applicant's application to the other Volunteer Data Centers, the Blood Donor Center, the Mobile Blood Donor Team and the Red Crescent Blood Donor Unit and the donor candidate will recieve a phone call to be invited to give blood..
  • Detailed information will be given to the volunteer candidate and the candidate will sign 'Approval Form for the Bone Marrow Donation'. After that Serologic tests (HbsAg, Anti HCV, Anti HIV and Syphilis) and blood type tests are carried out by the Qatar Red Crescent by taking 10-20 ml blood samples from the donor candidate in total of 3 tubes.
  • Following the completion of the mentioned tests, the blood samples of eligible candidates are submitted to the relevant facility for Tissue Typing Laboratory for HLA (tissue) typing.
  • Tissue typing is a mandatory test to determine tissue compatibility between donor and patient.
  • HLA information of donors who have undergone tissue typing are transferred to National Bone Medicine Board.
  • For patients in need of transplantation, this information is searched through this information network and information is provided by contacting the donor Qatar Red Crescent officers (if 10/10 and 9/10 tissue compatibility is detected).
  • The consent is obtained again from the donor. Tissue typing is performed again from the new blood samples from the donor and the patient and planning of the transplantation period is initiated when compatible. This process takes 4-6 weeks on average.
Who is a Voluntary Bone Marrow Donor?

The Voluntary Bone Marrow Donor is a citizen who is registered with the PHR system and who accepts the conditions in the form of consent and confirms the identity number, cell phone, province and district information to be shared with the Qatar Red Crescent.

Do I have to pay?

Bone marrow donation does not require any fee from you for the procedures performed. In addition, no payment is made to you. The system is entirely based on volunteerism.

How is Confidentiality of Information Provided?

There is no information exchange between the donor and the patient to prevent the identification of each other. This is legally defined for the purpose of protecting the donor and the patient from any material or moral demand. The donated stem cell product is only barcoded with a number for that product and never contains personal information of the donor.
bon-marrow-blood-donation.modal-text-1: Blood Donation is giving blood by healthy eligible volunteers to be used for injured or sick patients who need blood transfusion. The blood donation process is a safe and simple procedure. First, your blood donation safety is checked by asking many questions about your medical history and by performing a brief physical examinations including checking your blood pressure, pulse rate, hemoglobin, temperature, and checking that you have suitable veins for collection. Undesirable reactions might happen, but these are usually very trivial and they do not represent any significant risks to you.
bon-marrow-blood-donation.modal-text-2: A blood donor is advised to have ample rest, enough sleep and take a snack meal prior to the process of blood donation.
bon-marrow-blood-donation.info-btn: Register your interest to become a blood donor
bon-marrow-blood-donation.redirect-btn: Redirect me to Qatar Blood Donor Center's website
bon-marrow-blood-donation.confirm-swicth: I agree to share my National Number, mobile phone number and blood type for bone marrow donation.

maps-information.data-not-found: The information registered to the location you are looking for could not be found.

smart-assistant.bmi-alert-info: Please enter your recent height and weight to calculate your Body Mass Index

sharing.title: Sharing Information
sharing.temporarly-shared-alert-box: * To temporarily share your health information, you can share via the Visit button in the My visits section. Your temporary shares will be displayed here.
sharing.temporarly-shared-not-found-alert-box: You do not have any registered data.
sharing.info-my-dependents: This section allows you to access the profiles of the users who are listed as your dependants.
sharing.my-sharing-info: This section displays the users that you have shared your profile with, and allows you to change the related settings.
sharing.step-sharing-0: In order to share your health information successfully with other PHR users, please follow the steps:
sharing.step-sharing-4: 4 - Specify the date range of the sharing period.
sharing.step-sharing-1: 1 - Specify the access information that you allow the recipient PHR user to access.
sharing.step-sharing-2: 2 - Enter the Qatar ID of the recipient PHR user whom you want to share your record with.
sharing.step-sharing-3: 3 - Enter one of the phone numbers registered to the recipient PHR user with whom you want to share your record.
sharing.step-sharing-5: 5 - Click on 'Send verification code', a code will be sent to the recipient PHR user with whom you want to share your record.
sharing.step-sharing-6: 6 - Contact the recipient PHR user with whom you want to share your record, and correctly enter the code they received
sharing.step-sharing-8: 8 - A verification code will be sent to your phone number that is registered as preferred from your profile information. Enter the code you received.
sharing.menu-error: You must select at least one menu for sharing
sharing.step3-title: Recipient PHR User's Information and Date Range
sharing.step2-alert: 'Access permissions' allows you to specify which health data and related pages you want the recipient PHR user to access.
sharing.step3-alert: Here you should enter the Qatar ID of the recipient PHR user and the phone number registered to the recipient PHR user with whom you want to share the health data you specified in the previous step.
sharing.step3-alert-2: Next, you should specify the date range of the sharing period and click on 'Send Verification Code' to send a verification code to the recipient PHR user. Lastly, you should contact the recipient PHR User and enter the code they have received correctly before clicking 'Save'.
sharing.verify-alert: The verification code you have entered is correct. Please proceed with the final step to save this sharing.
sharing.verify-error-alert: The code you have entered is incorrect. You can request a new code and try again.
sharing.step4-success: Your sharing information has been saved successfully. You can preview your sharing details in 'My Sharing' List.
sharing.step4-error: The code you have entered is incorrect. You can request a new code and try again.
sharing.last-step-alert: You have reached the last step in the process. To edit your sharing operation, you have to cancel and go through the steps again.
sharing.sharing-with-me-info: This section allows you to access the profiles of the users who have consented to share their health records with you.
sharing.sharing-confirm-info: Verification code has been send to your phone. Please insert the vericaiton code and save to continue.

password-change.alert-info: You can change your password in this section by simply confirming your current password and entering your new password twice.
password-change.account-settings: By deactivating your account, you will no longer have access to your personal health record. However, your health information will be shared with healthcare professional as per the default consent settings. To reactivate your account, you will need to re-register

appointments.no-address: No location information found for this appointment
appointments.title: Appointments List
appointments.appointments-info: This page is dedicated to show the future appointments. To view previous visits, please go to 'Visits History' page from the menu panel.
appointments.no-future-appointments: No future appointments available within the next 1 year

evaluate.feedback-message: Please answer all the questions to submit your evaluation.
evaluate.received-service: - How easy was it for you to schedule an appointment or obtain timely access to the healthcare services you needed?
evaluate.physician: - How effectively did the doctors address your concerns and provide clear explanations?
evaluate.health-care-personnel: - How well did the nurses attend to your concerns and provide clear explanations?
evaluate.facility-cleanliness: - How would you rate the healthcare provider's explanation of the potential risks and benefits of the treatment options available to you?
evaluate.healthcare-needs: - Based on your experience, would you consider returning to this hospital future healthcare needs?
evaluate.overall-quality: - How would you rate the overall quality of care you received?
